FOUND IN: Thoroughbred: An equine racehorse with a pedigree focused on speed and agility; also used in reference to other horse breeds that exhibit similar traits.
Creditor's associate: Another person associated with a creditor (one who is owed).
Ringmaster: Historically, the ringmaster was an orchestra conductor-like figure in a circus setting who coordinated performers' movements during acts
Amazons: A legendary tribe of fierce female warriors from ancient Greek mythology, often said to have originated in the steppes of Scythia.
Enigmatic pseudonym (referring to Sir Arthur Conan Doyle)

CLUE: Cut of meat from between rib and haunch
